Recovery of the Cost of Care
Under
38 U.S.C. 1729
, the U.S. has the right to recover or collect the cost of medical care VA furnishes to a Veteran for treatment of a non-service connected disability.Â  Costs recoverable from insurance companies or other third parties liable under a healthcare contract are the amounts the Veteran or the service provider would be able to receive if the care had not been provided by the U.S.
However, recovery of such costs does not limit the applicability of
38 CFR 3.552(b)(1)
.
